utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi, good afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hello.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi %uh this is %uh tour guide one

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh and my name is Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hello, I am participant number four my name is Lorena.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi Lorena.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hello.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hello.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm planning to make a visit on Singapore and I'm wondering if you can help me out to make my stay memorable.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay sure, and %uh when do you plan to come to Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well actually I'm planning to go there May- on May twenty six, twenty seven.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, just for two days?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes two days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh would you be coming with any other people?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'll be coming with my husband because it's his birthday and I'm planning to give him a surprise.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes and I promised him to have a tour in Singapore but that was %um like two years ago and I think this is the right time that I can %um give that promise to him.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's a birthday treat.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is there-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and how many days were you be spending here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think %um two to three days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And is there anything in particular that your husband would like to see?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm honestly nothing in particular because %uh all we %uh just love to do is to shop, eat and just travel and %um make sure to %uh see all the beautiful places in Singapore. But-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: just travel and %um make sure to %uh see all the beautiful places in Singapore. But-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: By the way %uh what's the number one %um tourist place in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Number one?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh right now I would say Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Does he like to see %uh wildlife as well?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um yes, he will definitely love that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %um I'm hearing a lot about Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think that will be great if I'll be able to visit there also.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And does he like a little bit of relaxation or more adventure?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think we will love both because we want to relax and

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: maybe on the first day we can %um have some adventures like %um what you have told me to %uh visit wildlife and other stuffs but I also love to have relaxation maybe on the second day or the third day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh what you can do is- because just now you also mentioned to %uh look around Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what I will suggest is %uh the first day you could do a little bit of sightseeing and %uh also include either our zoo and Night Safari for first day and second day Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh third day with a little bit of shopping %um and relaxation.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: How does that sound to you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That sounds great.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um by the way %um I have %uh one thousand Singaporean dollars %um budget for the tour.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Will that be %uh sufficient for the two of us or we need to %uh have additional budget?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I think it's quite fine with a thousand dollars it's actually quite fine.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can actually make do with that %uh in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh coming in from the airport %uh

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: do you have any %uh hotel in mind?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: None.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Not at all?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes not at all.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: We're still %um- if you can suggest some hotel that we can stay that will be very helpful for us.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay %uh there are quite a number of places that you can stay

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh and it's quite easy to get around using the subway trains we call it the MRT out here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is- %uh the MRT from Changi is on the East, it is a green line.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %um it is fairly easy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you buy a standard ticket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you just look for the place that you are %uh- that the location that you will be alighting and then the price will be flashed on the screen and you just pay accordingly.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what I will suggest is %uh change some Singapore money at the airport either inside the transit hall or just outside after your collection of the bags there are money changer there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you just change some small Singapore money like %uh a dollar coins, two dollars notes and five dollars note to help- just to %uh- for your travelling needs on the subway and to try out some local food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh do you mean if I take- if we took the subway it can take us to anywhere in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes almost anywhere in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: almost anywhere.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have like %uh from Changi Airport is the East to the West line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you take all the way you come to the West that's Jurong.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then we have another line, the red colour line that's North to the South or South to the North line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then we have a purple line %uh that goes from the %uh- %uh that goes from the North-East line.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's the purple line?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um how about- so you told me that if I took the East line it will take me all the way to the West, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So  if I already reach West line so you mean there's another %uh place there where I can go to North line?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh no.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh can you see the map now on the %uh Internet?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um not yet.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you please show me a map?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, just give me a minute.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, no problem.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think you should get it very soon in the next few seconds.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay I'm seeing it now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see number three on your right hand side?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Number three, %oh yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the ne~ %uh-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you move to the left you see expo?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you have to change your train from here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh- so you have to change your train at Tanah Merah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah from Tanah Merah you follow the green line all the way down.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I'm seeing it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And can you see a crossing between the red and the green line?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes that's the City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's City Hall, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is actually one of the terminal station, %uh you can change line from here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh now I understand.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So there are some point where I can make a stop if I desire to change lines.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now- Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And actually if you go back to Tanah Merah you go to the left you will see Paya Lebar.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That is also another line that you can change, it's to the yellow line or if you move up a little bit to the purple line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the crisscross between yellow and green?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, that's the Paya Lebar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, and then you- Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you move up you will be able to see Serangoon across between yellow and purple.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this are like- once you see an intersection %uh with these two round circle, these are %uh stations that you can change line.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh thank you for that information.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you are moving from Changi that's to the- you're in the East.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let's say you're going to take somewhere to Bugis if you move to the left.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh then you just go to the direction to Bugis.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if I want to go wildlife on my first day how can I get there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay now can you look to the red line?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you find the red line towards the North?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you find- %uh there's a intercross- intersection between the red and yellow?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Marymount?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Lorong Chuan.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then you move up- Yes, you move up a little bit to Ang Mo Kio.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh so it's in Ang Mo Kio?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's not in Ang Mo Kio from there you have to change a bus to go to the zoo and Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how much will that cost me?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: the ticket for entrance in Night Safari?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, let me- Okay, you are just going to the Night Safari Park, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, let me just show you- alright, can you see now?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Not yet,

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: it- I think it's still loading in my end.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: There.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, you got it?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just a minute it's still loading.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's up now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's up now, %uh. Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Night Safari Park opens from seven thirty to twelve midnight.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the admission cost is thirty two dollars for an adult.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's- Looks interesting.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So basically you will be doing a tram ride.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And on the tram ride you will be able to see more than seventy per cent of the- what the Night Safari has to offer and there are a few walking tours that you can do on the Night Safari Park.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But most of the time we will be riding?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you'll be riding as in, in the park you mean?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, in the park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, on the tram because %uh the western loop of the Night Safari you can't walk so you will have to- I would suggest that you take %uh a tram ride midway.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the leopard now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Not yet, I'm still on the elephant.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is a stop at the %uh leopard %uh trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you could get off the leopard trail, do a half an hour walk and then come back to the same tram station to board back the next tram ride and that will bring you back to the entrance.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this ride itself excluding the walk is about forty minutes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Forty minutes at- %um all in all.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just on the tram, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a slow ride and you can see the animals very up-close.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For example-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Really?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, quite close.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are we allowed to touch the animals?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no because they are wild animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are not like %uh trained so it's just that they live in this protected park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So please do not stretch out your hands or any part of your body.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thanks for the-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And aside from the Night Safari what are other places that we can visit?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I think we will wait- we will need to wait until seven thirty before we will be able to make a tour there, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what are the other place that I can %uh travel maybe on the afternoon on my first day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, in the- Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In the afternoon you could either do %uh the zoo %uh as well because they are all- they are just located %uh next door to one another and you are looking at different animals.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah so you mean the zoo is different from the Night Safari?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, they are just next door to one another so it's totally different.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you are seeing- in the zoo you'll be seeing more mammals %uh like the orang-utan, the chimpanzee.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for the Night Safari it will be more of the nocturnal creatures like the %uh %uh tigers, the leopards %uh basically animals that hunt in the night time.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is something that you may want to consider.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh otherwise on the first day %uh you could also do a little bit of %uh sightseeing around Singapore %uh going to the ethnic areas of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I think that will be great.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you could do a little bit of the %uh Chinatown area, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you could also do a little bit of the Kampong Glam and Little India in the morning the whole day, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then in the night you can take %uh all these %uh places that I've mentioned

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: are accessible on the MRT except that you may have to just to change trains but like I mentioned it's fairly easy to get around.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But do you also have bars or night %uh clubs in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, we do have quite a lot of the %uh bars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so maybe the first day you could do that and %uh if let's say after your %uh Night Safari and you're not too tired you can bring your husband, yourself relax %uh- I would like to recommend you the Clarke Quay area or Boat Quay area, that's in the Southern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And what we'll be able to see there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Basically there are a lot of bars there so you could have a drink.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and of course I'd like to recommend you- %um specially concocted in Singapore it's called the Singapore gin sling.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that is something %uh one of our signature drink that you can get in any of the bars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but of course if you like something very traditional

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: then it will be at the Raffles Hotel the long bar over at the Raffles Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But what's the-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's also on the Southern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What's the best drink that you have tried yourself?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Best drink.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I would say other drinks other than liquor some traditional drinks %uh bubble tea where we can get from small bubble tea shops.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the Indian drink will be lassi %uh the Malay drinks would teh tarik.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um how does bubble drink taste?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it sweet or sour?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, norm~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Normally it's a tinge of sweetness.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's tea %uh mixed with a lot of different kind of %uh fruits but it is not %um- it doesn't- it's not as thick as a smoothie.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are the other drinks that we have %uh other than cocktail drinks or wine.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm, I think it-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think the %uh the bubble tea is healthy because it's tea and fruits.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can get this bubble tea from a lot of counters %uh and they are usually counters located in shopping %uh complex.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you would be able to find one such store otherwise in some of our food centres you maybe a to~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: me~ you may be able to find them as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh because you know here in our place we have lots of convenient stores that you can see almost around if you're going to make a %uh stroll on the night or even day time.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's very easy to buy something %um everywhere.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you also have lots of convenient stores in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I guess we do have a lot of convenient stores.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um the local chain would be like Cheers, C H E E R S. It's a small convenient store.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay otherwise %uh every other %uh let's say front of some shopping centres you will also find little cafés.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh are you talking about like to get snacks and drink?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So yes, one of the local ones would be like Cheers %um and then we have like supermarket, there is always one in %uh the major shopping centres, there is always a supermarket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have %uh the local chain would be NTUC, %uh Cold Storage, Shop N Save.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh these are the kind of %uh I would say supermarket and you can always find one %uh of this supermarket in %uh the shopping centres.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can always get your drinks, your snacks basically do even marketing.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how about shopping malls?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, lots of them.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh major shopping centres located at the Orchard belt area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so Orchard Road it's one straight road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again if you remember correctly if you take the green line to the left and then to City Hall there's a big shopping centre there called Raffles City.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Beneath the road there is CityLink.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you take another few stops away %uh that's to Orchard Road MRT train station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh on that same stretch of road there are lots and lots of shopping centre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is the Orchard Road the main city?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well I would say that Singapore is one city but it is a place where a lot of the locals, the tourists go there for people watching, %uh do a bit of shopping as well as have tea, dinners, lunch.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a place where you can do a lot of things out there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I remember I have one friend who had %um on-the-job training %um in Singapore %um because %um when she's graduating here %um her school send her to Singapore and I remember the word Orchard.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because that's the one where- that she always mentioned to me when she came back and she's telling me stories about the places that she has been.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I've been hearing the word Orchard that's why I'm asking.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's %um- actually this street name is actually named after the street before we developed into Orchard Road used to be a plantation, Orchard Plantation that's how this street gets its name.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so like some of the major shopping centre would be %um Tangs Studio, Tangs, %uh Ngee Ann City which is a huge shopping complex.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: ION, it's %uh one of the latest addition %uh nice shopping centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just all across one another and next to one another.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay then if you go further down the street you have Paragon, %uh Plaza Singapura, %um the Centrepoint, okay %uh one three one and we also have %uh H&M now in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you have like a map of that place so that I can- I have %um a look of the malls, shopping- different shopping malls that are interconnected there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me- Yes, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay %uh I'm actually giving you the map now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see %uh this shopping centre on top is called ION?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is- Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then you can see some of the street scene, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I will also give you the map now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I'm seeing- Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm giving you the map now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- okay, this is one whole- okay, can you see this yellow box thing somewhere around number ten?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Number fifteen, number twenty two.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Number fifteen, number ten the square yellow thing.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What's that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is like the beginning of Orchard belt.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this whole street.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you see all the blue buildings they are all %uh hotels or shopping complexes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So you mean from this yellow square until %uh the number forty two blue square?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: All the way that's all Orchard Road?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Shopping.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are all shopping.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So all the blue buildings are either shops or- I mean shopping mall or hotels.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm, until forty nine?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh that's great.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Forty- Yah, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you could actually spend the whole day there if you want to.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I guess so.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah So %uh the shopping hours in Singapore %uh starts at ten o'clock finish at-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Ten A.M?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Ten A.M. and finish at nine thirty.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And do you have all the popular brands that I can shop like %um do you have- what are the popular %um brands that I can %um see in the shopping malls?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because %uh-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well you have the- Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I'm not sure if %uh the brands here are the same on the %um malls in Singapore, so what are some of the popular brands of clothes and %um other stuffs that I can buy?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have of course the luxury brands %uh Gucci, Coach, Prada.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are located in most of these shopping centres like number thirty, twenty two ION we have them.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you move on to twenty seven that is Paragon, right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are the major brands can be found here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course twenty three as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay and number twenty six, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are the luxury brands that you can find %uh usually on the first level.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh on the basement area and upper floors %uh you can get the mid-range and some of our local brands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I think right now the local bags and shoe brand, we have a home grown brand called %uh Charles And Keith.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are found in %uh number twenty two, that's ION.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh number twenty six, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and also twenty three, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are- and of course over in number forty seven alright, that's Plaza Singapura.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are found in these shopping mall so this is %um home %uh home grown so I don't think you have this brand in %uh Philippines.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about %um places where I can buy shoes and bags?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The brand that I just mentioned, you can buy them.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh otherwise if you don't like this brand %uh or you don't like- you can't find any of the %uh correct patterns that you want, in all these shopping centres you'll be able to find other %uh stores %uh selling shoes, bags.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So all these shopping centres will have %uh things like shoes, bag, %uh sunglasses, %uh jewellery okay, they can be found in all these shopping complexes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow that's very nice to hear.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well aside from shopping I'm also interested to visit some of the government %um offices in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are we allowed- I mean are tourist allowed to visit like government offices or different %um places where I can see some of the %um government sites in your place?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what particular- %uh which %uh particular government offices you would like to visit?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like for example %um if I want to see how the City Hall looks like in Singapore compared to our %uh City Hall here in Philippines like post offices, all that stuffs.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are we allowed or-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The post offices %uh yes because it's a public area so you can just walk in to any of our post offices in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the City Hall right now is %uh not used as a City Hall anymore we are %uh refurbishing it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we're renovating it and it's going to become one of our art gallery.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what I will suggest is if you want to pay a visit to our URA, that's near to the Chinatown area, it's called Urban Renewal Authority.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they- we do have a very good city gallery, a gallery that you can see %um the whole map of Singapore as well as %uh the central part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about %um like a national museum, do you have one?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes we have a very good %uh national museum at the Bras Basah area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- %uh that will showcase Singapore from the beginning right up to %uh the present day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how the- how Singapore evolved from years %um from different eras, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh it showcase you %uh even before Raffles' arrival %uh right through %uh to second World Wa~ %uh and then Raffles arrived, where do people live you know we have kings before.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we move on to the second World War period from nineteen forty three to nineteen forty five and to present day, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh to col~ %uh to independence to merger we sing~ %uh sorry before our independence nineteen sixty three to nineteen sixty five we merged with %uh Malaya to form the Federation of Malaysia.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And independence how we struggle through %uh to- in order to find- to build homes for the people living here, jobs, to modern day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um, s~

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So you mean-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I will really be able to learn a lot about Singapore in that place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh you'll be able to %uh learn a lot about Singapore in fact %uh the whole history of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think I will put that %um on my list, of places to visit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you are going to Chinatown, so you can pay a visit there okay, then you learn ab~ %uh sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the history of Singapore you will learn from the National History of Singapore-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh National %uh Museum of Singapore at the %uh Bras Basah area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And after that you can do the URA Gallery %uh and the Chinatown area together.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it on same area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the URA, Urban Redevelopment Authority it's the same area as Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The National Museum will be closer to the Supreme Court.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because you mentioned that you wanted to do some Singapore %uh %uh offices, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Sup~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we wouldn't- you can also sit-in one of the Court sessions in the Supreme Court if you are just %uh yourself and your husband.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So any of the Courts that's open for hearing you can actually walk in %um even for a ten minutes if you just want to sit-in and you can just give-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Really?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh so- %uh you've mentioned that %uh we are allowed to enter one of the Courts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but %uh before you enter into the Supreme Court you will have to go through security.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So just like how you will pass through %uh the Immigration while coming in %uh or leaving Singapore the normal security %uh procedure that means you have check- we will have to check your bags %um and you make sure that you do not carry any %uh sharp objects and %uh there's no- strictly no photography inside the Supreme Court.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Really?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because it really delights me to know it because- actually personally I want to have a tour in one of the Supreme Courts %uh in Singapore because I used to do transcriptions in Court proceedings.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, that's great.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes %uh that's why it delighted me when you mentioned that I can also have a tour in the Supreme Court because %um honestly I'm very- I'm curious on how the persons that I used to transcribe %um I mean I really want to see them in person, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um- but are we allowed to sit-in in like for if there is an on-going trial and are we allowed to sit-in on the proceeding?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes you are allowed to.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like I mentioned you just have to go through security before you enter into the Court- %uh before you enter into the Supreme Court the normal %uh procedure meaning like no sharp objects and strictly no photography when you are inside the Supreme Court.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But only for a limited time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh office hours I would say.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Aside from Supreme Courts %um what are %uh the other government places that we can visit?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the Supreme Court ch~ sit-in one of the Court proceedings.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh like I said if you don't want to sit you can sit-in for as long or as short as you want to.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the URA would be %uh a good introduction to our city landscape.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like I said you can do it with- together with Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Supreme Court you can do it together with the National Library- %uh sorry %uh National Museum of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So you also have National Libraries?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Oh yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The library is also located near the %uh Bras Basah area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So National Library, National %uh Museum, Supreme Court.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that will be also around the National Museum area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Pretty nearby.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I can also drop by?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The library is a green building.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That means they have a lot of %uh green itianative- %uh initiative that is %uh built into the whole library.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But we have a lot of other %uh community libraries all found within the various estate in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So enough for the government places.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about place for relaxation?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What are the places that %uh I can have some memorable experiences there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have %uh Sungei Buloh which is on the Northwest of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you saw the Supreme Court, right on the screen?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, that's the picture of the Supreme Court.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do another wildlife walk over at Sungei Buloh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that still on the East?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that is Northwest.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Northwest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What can I see on that %um area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are mangrove and %uh wetland wildlife so a lot of birds.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you saw a picture now of the Sungei Wetland?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: National Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is %um what we have out at the %uh Northwest of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we do have a free wireless %uh trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you can just %uh sort of %uh borrow the %uh %uh %uh webcam.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And another %uh other walks that you can do you climb %uh Bukit Timah Hill as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you have mountains?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well %uh Bukit Timah is not a mountain it's a hill.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We don't have mountains in Singapore unfortunately.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Our tallest hill is Bukit Timah but it has a lot of %uh flora and fauna.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And- but how high is the hill?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's three hundred and eighty six %uh metres tall.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like %um how many how many floors  of a building?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: How many floor?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Approximately about %uh sixty- I would say I think in a region of about sixty to seventy storey.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Approximately.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Really?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's a bit %um high sixty to seventy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A bit high?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Oh but you are not going to climb steps it's like %uh a slope going up the hill and %uh well you can do it within- you can climb from the bottom to the top of hill.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is not %uh a too fast running up just walking a brisk walk you should be able to arrive in one hour.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %um are there also transport available?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no you have to climb up.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you see a lot of interesting plants %uh when you are up on the- %uh along the way up to the hill.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about %um hotels?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What are the number one hotel that you can offer me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay just %uh- I think you should be able to see a portion of the road climbing up to Bukit Timah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay you've seen that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The visitor centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay I'll come back to the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay now let-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Nature reserve.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright let's go to the hotels in Singapore %uh. There are lots of different category of hotels So again it depends on %uh what you're looking at.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there are budget hotels.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you like to stay in Orchard Road, %uh since this is a birthday celebration %uh-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah you can consider staying around Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So you mean there are several hotels in- along Orchard Road?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are lots of- Yah there are lot of hotels on Orchard Road so it all depends on your %uh price %uh category.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh starting from %uh- just beginning of Orchard Road %uh at the junction of Scotts Road we have like Hyatt Hotel, Marriott Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you move on we have Grand Park Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again I'm coming back to the stretch of Orchard Road %uh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have like %uh %uh York Hotel just beside the Goodwood Park Hotel, Elizabeth Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay so %uh these are all the various hotel that is located on %uh %uh Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then if-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um do the hotels offer like one day stay so- because I'm thinking if it's possible for us to stay on different hotels every day so that we could have different experiences?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah %uh will that be fine?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, that's fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they do have %uh you can have a one night stay %uh in the various hotel so normal check-in like two to three o'clock in the afternoon %uh and the next day the check out time %uh is around twelve o'clock %uh the next day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because %um I want to have %um one- a bit expensive stay like on the second day if I'm going to get a 3 day visit.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm planning to make the second day a very special one so if ever I'm going to get %um a hotel that will have like a Jacuzzi and all those special %um things that we can enjoy.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So- and like for the %uh third day on- or the first and the third day we can get like a hotel that we can basically make a stay before going to the adventures that we want to do like in the wildlife because basically we will not be able to stay the whole day, right on the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'm planning if we can get a %uh a hotel that we can stay just for one day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay there are quite a number of hotels %uh what you mentioned.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there is like %uh Fullerton Bay Hotel, it's like a five-star luxury hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the the- and this building just now you mentioned about post office, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It used to be %uh the first %uh Central Post Office in Singapore but it's now converted to %uh Fullerton Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that's one, it's a five-star luxury.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have at City Hall MRT Fairmont Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: On Sentosa itself since I think you may also visit Sentosa you could stay at the Capella.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But these are- like I mentioned these are %uh five-star luxury hotels.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Five-star.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, or you could also stay at the Marina Bay Sands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is like %uh landmark building.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it faces the Marina Bay so you get a good %uh view and of course remember to ask for the bay view side of the hotel, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and around the bay you have other hotels like %um the Pan Pacific, the Mandarin Oriental, these are all %uh nice hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay so lots and lots of hotels available if you just want something very special.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it just depends on the on the place where we will stay, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, and also %uh the budget %uh that you would like to spend because %uh they range %uh from- in the region of about Singapore dollars one night stay about four hundred plus.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, the budget.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: On five-star hotels?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, they are five-star hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But on the %um normal hotels, how much basically is the price?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are talking about %uh let's say %uh a hundred and fifty to two hundred dollars?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we have some of these hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is one in the Orchard belt it's called the Hotel Supreme, it's near to the Plaza Singapura.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm also seeing East Village.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: East Village?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay that's a bit far off.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: On East Coast.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, it's a little bit far off.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay, maybe I can also recommend you this hotel called %uh Link Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's in-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Ling?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Link, L I N K.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh Link.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Link Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it is located in the residential area called Tiong Bahru and you are about %uh just one MRT away from Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or %uh- that's a three-star hotel, we move down it's Oxford Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's also a good location %uh but they don't have facilities like the spa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay but you can stay there as well for one night then you do your museums, your ethnic area and then the next day you move to a nice hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that would be in the region of below two hundred dollars per night.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And- Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that will cost me like four hundred for- if I'm going to stay on my first and third day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yah, that's right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Right-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how about Sentosa?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Sentosa of course the best- %uh there's a-

utterances.transcript: How- What are the- What are the things that I can see there?

utterances.transcript: What you- Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Sentosa there are lots of things, there is the beach, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do your morning %uh swim in the beach, the lagoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then you can go to the Universal theme park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can go by %uh cable car to Sentosa form %uh either Mount Faber or HarbourFront.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's linked to the mainland, it's an island off the Southern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it is one big playground.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's one big playground, alright.

utterances.transcript: Now-

utterances.transcript: So we need-

utterances.transcript: Is it where we can do Karting?

utterances.transcript: %Uh we have what we call the luge.

utterances.transcript: what's that?

utterances.transcript: Yes, something like that.

utterances.transcript: %Uh but there is %uh fixed routing that you have to do.

utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so you-

utterances.transcript: So it's like a bicycle?

utterances.transcript: %Uh I wouldn't say it's like a bicycle, you don't ride you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You basically press on like %uh accelerator.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A little bit like %uh those bumper cars but it's not built like a bumper car it is more open.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay I will show you what the luge is like.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Can you show me one?

utterances.transcript: Yah, %um-

utterances.transcript: It's still loading.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you mean I just need to have- %uh I just need to pay on the entrance or I need to pay on every rides that I want to %uh try?

utterances.transcript: %Uh no. This one you will have to pay extra %uh- okay there are different %uh admission prices.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let's say if you want to do %uh the two- %uh the luge alright %uh that's eighteen dollars.

utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: It looks very %uh enjoyable.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's quite great fun %uh doing the luge.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The prices for just one luge and one Skyride will be twelve dollars and fifty cents per person.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.transcript: So this is the extra %uh prices that you will have to pay
